alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clarendon; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 8:43PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Calhoun, Clarendon and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 843 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orangeburg, Brookdale, St. Matthews, Holly Hill, Branchville, Bowman, Elloree, Santee State Park, Orangeburg County Airport, South Carolina State University, Claflin College, Edisto Gardens, Santee, Cameron, Eutawville, Rowesville, Vance, Cordova, Yonder Field and Creston. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 103. Interstate 26 between mile markers 137 and 169. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown.
